DataElement.preferredName: Physician Expedited Report Adverse Event Review Approval Complete Checkbox Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Notation that a physician or medically certified designee responsible for the care of a patient has reviewed and approved an expedited adverse event report.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Physician Expedited Report Adverse Event Review Approval Complete
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon._A report or observation of one or more adverse events that must be submitted within a specified amount of time due to the severity of one or more of the events._Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._The act of appraisal, evaluation, or analysis._Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.:Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:A report or observation of one or more adverse events that must be submitted within a specified amount of time due to the severity of one or more of the events.

Concepts.definition: A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
A report or observation of one or more adverse events that must be submitted within a specified amount of time due to the severity of one or more of the events.

Property.preferredDefinition: An investigator who is responsible for all aspects of the conduct of a study.:The act of appraisal, evaluation, or analysis.:Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: An investigator who is responsible for all aspects of the conduct of a study.
The act of appraisal, evaluation, or analysis.
Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator determining determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Checking "I certify" means th
ReferenceDocuments.description: Checking "I certify" means that this report has been reviewed and approved by a physician or his/her medically certified designee responsible for the care of this patient.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRDS Alternate Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Checking "I certify" means that this report has been reviewed and approved by a physician or his/her medically certified designee responsible for the care of this patient.
